intro.paragraph1: Orbital Temple is a satellite with an artistic mission: a memorial in outer space open to every sentient being who live or has lived on Earth.
intro.paragraph2: Through technological means, anyone can send the name of someone to the Temple, either someone who passed away, a person very much alive, or any being that deserves to be remembered.

sculpture.heading: The Sculpture
sculpture.paragraph1: The artwork has three co-dependent elements: a satellite especially designed to store billions of names; a public sculpture exchanging information with the satellite; and a website through which participants send the names, from now until they are passed away, to heaven.
sculpture.paragraph2: As a multidisciplinary endeavor, Orbital Temple can be considered a site-specific sculpture, inhabiting space. It is also an Artsat project.

antenna.heading: The Antenna As A Public Sculpture
antenna.paragraph1: An antenna connecting us with outer space.
antenna.paragraph2: An antenna that will be in direct communication with the orbital satellite is being designed.
antenna.paragraph3: With a golden reflective surface, mirroring the sky above it, it is a starting point for mass stimulation (or our relationship to what's 'up there').
antenna.paragraph4: While the sculptures are not installed in most parts of the world, our Frames from Earth, which are currently controlling the satellite, is sending the names at each passthrough.
